name: John Doe

recipes.name: Sushi
recipes.description: Sushi is a traditional Japanese dish made with vinegared rice and various seafood, vegetables, or egg toppings. It is typically served with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
recipes.cooking_method: Rinse the sushi rice and cook it with water in a rice cooker or on the stove.Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt to make the seasoning for the rice.Cut the seafood, vegetables, and egg into small pieces.Lay out a sheet of nori on a sushi mat, spread rice on top, and add toppings.Roll the sushi tightly with the mat and cut into bite-size pieces.

recipes.name: Ramen
recipes.description: Ramen is a popular noodle soup dish that originated in Japan. It typically consists of wheat noodles in a flavorful broth, with toppings such as sliced pork, bamboo shoots, and soft-boiled eggs.
recipes.cooking_method: Cook the ramen noodles according to package instructions.Heat the broth in a pot and add soy sauce, mirin, and sake to taste.Cook the pork belly or sliced pork and bamboo shoots in the broth.Place the cooked noodles in a bowl and pour the broth over them.Top with soft-boiled eggs, nori sheets, and green onions.

recipes.name: Tempura
recipes.description: Tempura is a Japanese dish of battered and deep-fried seafood, vegetables, or other ingredients. The batter is light and crispy, and the dish is often served as an appetizer or side dish.
recipes.cooking_method: In a heatproof bowl, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until the mixture becomes pale and creamy. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water and add milk to the bowl. Cook the mixture...
